intro: Spiesia cabulica, commonly known as the Kabul spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it has a low, spreading growth habit. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated but is of interest in botanical and ecological studies.
